At Jawbone, I built & lead a team focusing on developing data products that promote a healthier lifestyle and on finding stories in the UP wearable data. Prior to Jawbone, I was one of the early members of the LinkedIn data science team, where I developed and improved some of LinkedIn’s key data products for matching jobs to passive candidates, discovering people you may know, and recommending groups you may like.Strong background in applied machine learning (CMU CS PhD), data science, wearables and health, social network analysis, recommender systems, statistical text mining and multilingual information retrieval (search). Fast Company's 100 most creative people in business; Fortune Magazine 2014 Big Data All-Stars.If you're a company where data is crucial to your mission and you're looking for an independent board member, let's talk. Monica liked See all activity Experience Data Science Advisor Company Name Independent Dates Employed 2012 – Present Employment Duration 5 yrs Location Sunnyvale, CA I help companies make the most out of their data -- both technically and strategically.Since 2012 (full time since 2015), I have formally advised companies at all stages (from seed to public) and in various areas (edu, health, fitness, IoT, security, consumer Internet). Depending on the company's stage and need, I focus on: building data products and teams; machine learning and infrastructure; finding stories in the data; recommender systems; data as a strategic asset; technical due diligence. Very pragmatic and results focused; a decade in academia taught me sophisticated algorithms and a decade in industry taught me when not to use them. Equity Partner Company Name Data Collective Dates Employed 2013 – Present Employment Duration 4 yrs Advisor and Guest Lecturer Company Name Stanford University Dates Employed 2013 – Present Employment Duration 4 yrs Advisor to the Stanford University’s Mobilize Center (an NIH Big Data Center)Guest lecturer the Graduate School of Business and several undergraduate classes. VP of Data Company Name Jawbone Dates Employed Jul 2013 – Jun 2015 Employment Duration 2 yrs I built a team of world class, full stack data scientists and engineers. At the intersection of wearables, data and the Internet of Things, we focused on developing products that promote a healthier lifestyle. My team used data to make smart, personalized and contextualized suggestions to help you achieve your goals. We automatically detect if you've been working out, automatically classify the type of workout, suggest foods you've eaten, show you interesting correlations in your activity/sleep/food data, and give you actionable advice. We built and maintained product & analytics infrastructure, shipped production code, designed & implemented the metrics, experiments and instrumentation, built interactive visualizations -- all in record time.Understanding sleep, activity and nutrition at scale led us to previously unimagined insights -- discoveries you couldn't make in a lab or with a survey. We’ve now established Jawbone as one of the top resource for understanding health implications of activity, sleep and nutrition. Here are a few examples:https://jawbone.com/blog/napa-earthquake-effect-on-sleep/https://jawbone.com/blog/jawbone-up-data-by-city/https://jawbone.com/blog/weight-loss/https://jawbone.com/blog/what-makes-people-happy/https://jawbone.com/blog/how-temperature-affects-exercise/https://jawbone.com/blog/sleep-week/https://jawbone.com/blog/circadian-rhythm/https://jawbone.com/blog/jawbone-up-common-pairings/https://jawbone.com/blog/jawbone-up-food-data/https://jawbone.com/blog/sleep-china/https://jawbone.com/blog/2014-year-review/https://jawbone.com/blog/new-years-eve/ Media (7) This position has 7 media Previous Next "Design Matters More than Math" -- Oxford-style debate @ O'Reilly Strata 2013 "Design Matters More than Math" -- Oxford-style debate @ O'Reilly Strata 2013 This media is a video Beyond Analytics - Building Data Products for Data Natives - Monica Rogati Beyond Analytics - Building Data Products for Data Natives - Monica Rogati This media is a video Meet the 2013 enterprise superstars Meet the 2013 enterprise superstars This media is a link Jawbone Tumblr, including our data stories Jawbone Tumblr, including our data stories This media is a link "Bedtime Stories (Learning from Sleep Data)" -- Monica Rogati @O'Reilly Strata 2014 "Bedtime Stories (Learning from Sleep Data)" -- Monica Rogati @O'Reilly Strata 2014 This media is a video Fortune Magazine: 2014 Big Data All-Stars Fortune Magazine: 2014 Big Data All-Stars This media is a link Fast Company: The 100 Most Creative People in Business 2014 Fast Company: The 100 Most Creative People in Business 2014 This media is a link Senior Data Scientist Company Name LinkedIn Dates Employed May 2008 – May 2013 Employment Duration 5 yrs 1 mo How do you know Darth Vader’s LinkedIn account is not real? View 6 more recommendations View 6 more recommendations recommendations Daniel Tunkelang High-Class Consultant May 3, 2016, Monica reported directly to Daniel If I told you somebody built a team of data scientists, then retained 100% of them for years while the data talent wars were in full swing, you’d probably say it must have been a mediocre team. Daniel’s team wasn’t -- most went on to become execs, founders and very successful data scientists, but while on Daniel’s team, they stayed. They knew he brings out the best in the people he leads, inspiring them not only to do their best work but also to develop new skills and grow into more senior roles. Daniel built and led several strong teams, and his combination of technical depth and leadership experience allows him to see both the big picture and the technical details. In addition, he has the ability, rare among senior technologists, to clearly communicate his knowledge and perspective to both technical and non-technical audiences through his writing and public speaking. But what really sets him apart is his integrity, empathy and transparency. I’m looking forward to working with Daniel again some day. More Actions DJ has a influencer account 3rd degree connection3rd DJ Patil Former U.S. Chief Data Scientist; built & run product teams @ LinkedIn etc; done a bunch of security and some data too Self University of Maryland College Park San Francisco Bay Area Connect Pending Invitation Sent I focus on building great products with data.Been fortunate to build some incredible teams in the consumer and enterprise spaceHad to fight lots of bad guys in the cyber arenaHad some good luck in Academia working on chaos theoryWorked in two Administrations on domestic & national security issues.Here's a bit more detail:Most recently DJ was appointed by President Obama to be the first U.S. Chief Data Scientist where his efforts led to the establishment of nearly 40 Chief Data Officer roles across the Federal government. He also established new health care programs including the Precision Medicine Initiative and the Cancer Moonshot, new criminal justice reforms including the Data-Driven Justice and Police Data Initiatives that cover more than 94 million Americans, as well as leading the national data efforts. He also has been active in national security and for his efforts was awarded by Secretary Carter the Dept. of Defense Medal for Distinguished Public Service which the highest honor the department bestows on a civilian. In industry, he led the product teams at RelateIQ which was acquired by Salesforce, was founding board member for Crisis Text Line which works to use new technologies to provide on demand mental and crisis support, and was a member of the venture firm Greylock Partners. He has also was Chief Scientist, Chief Security Officer and Head of Analytics and Data Product Teams at the LinkedIn Corporation where he co-coined the term Data Scientist. He has also held a number of roles at Skype, PayPal, and eBay. As a member of the faculty at the University of Maryland, his research focused on nonlinear dynamics and chaos theory and he helped start a major research initiative on numerical weather prediction. As an AAAS Science & Technology Policy Fellow for the Department of Defense, Dr. Patil directed new efforts to leverage social network analysis and the melding of computational and social sciences to anticipate emerging threats to the US. He holds a BSc and MSc in Mathematics and Statistics respectively, is a full-stack application developer specializing in Ruby and Javascript, and is an established technology entrepreneur. Previously, Matt worked as a mathematics professor at top Canadian colleges Saskatchewan Polytechnic and more recently at Centennial College where he was selected as the top faculty member by Centennial College's Board of Directors in 2012. However, Matt is most proud of his volunteer work. See moreSee more of undefined summary Highlights Follow Follow {:entityName} Victor Genin’s Activity 4,591 followers Barry’s photo Victor Genin commented You would think that the recent well publicised, self-inflicted PR disasters by United and American Airlines would alert operators to be a little less pedantic in the way they treat their customers. Well, I learned that easyJet has a cunning way of making extra money. At Gatwick's North Terminal, they advise passengers to stay in the main departure area until they announce the gate number. It takes 12 minutes to walk quickly from departure area to their gate. 15 minutes if the moving walkway isn't working. They allow 10 minutes before they close the gate. The moving walkway wasn't moving and I was 30 seconds late. I shouted that I've got a ticket for the flight as I was running toward the gate. You would think that the girl in charge had training in customer relations by the East German Stasi. The Berlin Wall was friendlier. I could see the plane. The doors were open and people were waiting on the stairs to enter the plane and she wouldn't let me board. All this to force me to buy another ticket. Another 6 people were caught in the same trap. EasyJet? Never again. Never again. Victor Genin commented This week, I attended the opening ceremony for Hewlett Packard Enterprise's new Asia Pacific and Japan Headquarters building in Singapore, where we have been based for 46 years. It was great to celebrate this milestone with our Singapore-based employees, Hewlett-Packard Alumni, and the Chairman of the Singapore Economic Development Board, Dr. Beh Swan Gin, who helped us officially open the building. More Actions Steve has a account Steve Green, PhD Director of Research and Evaluation at Tulsa Public Schools Tulsa Public Schools Indiana University Bloomington Tulsa, Oklahoma 107 107 connections Connect Pending Invitation Sent As a brain scientist turned data scientist, my passion lies in crushing massive data sets into high impact insights. Few things are more gratifying than when one of my cross-validated models nearly perfectly predicts an outcome variable. Also, I utterly love creating visually compelling figures to illustrate those insights. As a researcher analyzing data for over 15 years, I have utilized machine learning and advanced statistics to identify insights buried in big data. In studying the brain, I have used a variety of advanced statistical modeling including linear mixed models and the general linear model to find insights in massive sets of brain data (typically over 50 gigabytes). I have also performed predictive analytics in the form of logistic and linear regression to predict performance when solving puzzles. Using advanced statistics; including t-tests, chi-square, and analysis of variance I have tested statistical reliability in complicated electrophysiological data to simple frequency analysis in fire station calling data. More recently, I have reduced a multidimensional data set using exploratory factor analysis to identify factors which best predict the winning college football team. Sandeep produced accurate and timely reports (variety of Microsoft Office tools were used) covering staff workloads that provided a clear view of the teams current and future work. This was extremely important as the ratio of fraud clients to analysts was often high and juggling priorities was occasionally required. In order to keep a high flow of work flowing smoothly, strong project management skills are essential. Sandeep understood the steps and expected timelines needed to complete work and properly organized his team and client requests to ensure his staff’s commitments and objectives were met. Obviously, he was dedicated to his work and encouraged the same goal-oriented attitude from his team. Finally, as a manager and technical expert, Sandeep believed in setting examples for his team by rolling up his sleeves and getting involved first hand in projects. Managers often just delegate work to staff and rarely work alongside colleagues to resolve issues, discover new efficiencies and tools, and produce results. Sandeep enjoyed getting his hands in the midst of work and helping his team push heavy workloads along. This not only raised morale and respect throughout the team, but also opened up opportunities to find improvements that would benefit the staff in performing their job. Although my interaction with Sandeep was relatively short, I truly enjoyed working with him during this period. He was honest on difficult issues that allowed me to have a clear picture of the challenges he and his team faced. I appreciated such candor as it often is lacking in many work environments today. I found him very easy to work with and a true professional. I heartily recommend Sandeep as a colleague and would be only too happy to work with him again. Vesselin D. The Board will help steer the company on its path in creating big data analytic solutions using open source technology.http://syntasa.com/president-and-ceo-jay-marwaha-appoints-kirk-d-borne-ph-d-as-first-syntasa-advisory-board-member/ Executive Committee Member Company Name Astroinformatics and Astrostatistics International Organizations Dates Employed 2009 – Present Employment Duration 8 yrs Contributing to the international and national efforts to promote astrostatistics and astroinformatics as robust research disciplines: organizing international research conferences on astrostatistics and astroinformatics, and contributed to the creation of three new international and national organizations:(1) Vice President, International Astrostatistics and Astroinformatics (IAA) professional society.(2) Senior Steering Committee member, AAS (American Astronomical Society) Working Group on Astroinformatics and Astrostatistics.(3) Organizing Committee member, IAU (International Astronomical Union) Working Group in Astrostatistics and Astroinformatics.In addition... Vice President / Astronomer / Data Scientist Company Name ARIES Scientific Dates Employed 2005 – Present Employment Duration 12 yrs Location http://www.aries-scientific.org/ ARIES Scientific Inc. is a non-profit 501(c)(3) corporation, dedicated to the advancement of Science Research and STEM Education.Kirk Borne has advised and consulted with numerous federal agencies and private companies in data science areas, including data mining and large-scale data management. Professor of Astrophysics and Computational Science Company Name George Mason University Dates Employed 2003 – May 2015 Employment Duration 12 yrs Conduct Research, Teach Courses, Advise Students (undergraduate, graduate) in these areas: Astroinformatics, Data Science, Computational Astrophysics, Astronomy, Computational Science, Data Mining, Informatics, Scientific Databases.Co-creator of Data Science BS degree program.For over 30 years, Kirk Borne has studied the dynamics and evolution of galaxies within the context of colliding and merging galaxies, groups and clusters of galaxies, starbursting galaxies, active galaxies, and the mass assembly history of large and small scale structure in the Universe. Since 2000, he has developed & applied data mining & data science techniques on large astronomy data collections & sky survey databases, earth science remote sensing data collections, and more. He is investigating new and existing algorithms for the discovery of patterns, correlations, associations, and outliers (surprises) within highly dimensional astrophysical parameter spaces. These techniques are being used in several research areas, including: galaxy scaling relations, parameterization of the dynamics and evolution of galaxies and groups of galaxies, characterization and classification of time-varying astronomical events and targets of opportunity, and novelty detection within massive datasets. As part of this research, he is working with citizen science results from the Galaxy Zoo and Galaxy Merger Zoo projects. He is investigating research connections with other data-intensive disciplines, to explore opportunities for advancing research in a broad context, through the investigation and application of data science methods (informatics and statistics) in a manner that transcends discipline boundaries.He is one of the originators of the field of Astroinformatics, which is data science for astronomy research and education. He is working with education researchers to develop new pedagogies for science learning that engage students through active experiences using Big Data in the classroom. Jennifer Matosziuk Director of Recruitment and Branding August 21, 2015, Kirk worked with Jennifer in the same group I was fortunate to work with Dr. Borne as he considered and ultimately made a move to Booz Allen. His love for data science and his commitment to the art of data science was obvious within 30 seconds of talking to him. He is one of the world's most recognized and well-respected data scientists yet is the most humble rock star you will ever meet! He truly believes in growing the future generation (I mean he created the first ever data science collegiate program in the states) and continues to do so with Booz Allen. Within his first week at the firm, he had made a tremendous impact on our clients, internal staff and potential hires. He is an incredible recruiting asset and is willing to help in any way (how cool must it be to be interviewed by the guy who put data mining on the map!) Not only is he an amazing and legendary data scientist, he is also one of the nicest people I have ever met. I feel lucky to have worked with Kirk and am honored to call him my friend. Pragyansmita Nayak, Ph.D., CSM Principal Research Engineer (Apogee Research), StartingBloc Fellow, Featured Reviewer (ACM Computing Reviews) July 25, 2016, Kirk was Pragyansmita’s teacher Dr. Pragyansmita Nayak was my PhD doctoral student at George Mason University. She was a very quick learner of new topics, including data science, machine learning, and astrophysics! Her dissertation was a clever and important contribution to both machine learning research as well as astrophysics. That was quite amazing for someone who hasn't studied astrophysics formally. Her already strong programming skills provided a strong foundation for her innovative work with Bayesian Networks, which proved the depth and quality of her understanding and insights into this important set of algorithms that have a great future of applications in our data-rich world. She has won awards for her machine learning work at various events. Dr. Nayak is also a strong leader, mentor, and trainer. I am certain that her contributions will continue to be far-reaching, and her value to any organization will be quite strong, innovative, and effective. It’s even harder at a fast-moving, high-expecting company like Tesla. I had the pleasure of working directly for Carlo for my first year at Tesla and he made that time educational, valuable, and surprisingly enjoyable. Carlo was always approachable and happily willing to provide knowledge and advice from his vast experience in research, data, networking, and modeling. He encouraged me to take classes, attend conferences, trainings, etc. to ensure I was learning and able to dive into topics as I chose. Carlo is a rare data scientist who not only led a small team but also naturally served as a leader within the then-budding data science community at Tesla. He has strong communication and interpersonal skills and worked to ensure data, data analytics, and data science were being properly communicated and valued. Carlo is also an incredibly fun person to be around. You can rarely catch him without a smile on his face and he made every day coming into work a delight. See moreSee more of undefined summary Highlights Follow Follow {:entityName} Victor Genin’s Activity 4,591 followers Barry’s photo Victor Genin commented You would think that the recent well publicised, self-inflicted PR disasters by United and American Airlines would alert operators to be a little less pedantic in the way they treat their customers. Well, I learned that easyJet has a cunning way of making extra money. At Gatwick's North Terminal, they advise passengers to stay in the main departure area until they announce the gate number. It takes 12 minutes to walk quickly from departure area to their gate. 15 minutes if the moving walkway isn't working. They allow 10 minutes before they close the gate. The moving walkway wasn't moving and I was 30 seconds late. I shouted that I've got a ticket for the flight as I was running toward the gate. You would think that the girl in charge had training in customer relations by the East German Stasi. The Berlin Wall was friendlier. I could see the plane. The doors were open and people were waiting on the stairs to enter the plane and she wouldn't let me board. All this to force me to buy another ticket. Another 6 people were caught in the same trap. EasyJet? Never again. Never again. Victor Genin commented This week, I attended the opening ceremony for Hewlett Packard Enterprise's new Asia Pacific and Japan Headquarters building in Singapore, where we have been based for 46 years. It was great to celebrate this milestone with our Singapore-based employees, Hewlett-Packard Alumni, and the Chairman of the Singapore Economic Development Board, Dr. Beh Swan Gin, who helped us officially open the building. More Actions Sanket has a account Sanket Korgaonkar Director of Engineering at EGen Solutions Egen Solutions Utah State University, Department of Computer Science Chicago, Illinois 455 455 connections Connect Pending Invitation Sent I love Artificial Intelligence! A love story that started since I graduated high school in Mumbai has sustained itself admirably through the chaotic years of Computer Engineering - that blossomed through my Masters Thesis and is finally now a dream job for me. Over the years this love has seen me cajole my friends to run Neural Network simulations on their home computers when electricity in India was capricious. It has seen me almost run over by a vehicle on the Utah State campus as I was collecting data with my hands frozen. It has seen me change continents and time zones and leave everyone I ever knew to build a life in the US. It is my passion! We have always talked through computer code. And now I have the skills to celebrate this passion far and wide on scales unimaginable through Hadoop and the Big Data framework! If you are an organization that is invested in Big Data and are interested in my story - please do give me a call if only to chat! I love talking about Big Data, its many new dimensions - the fast pace of technological innovation and the beauty of the diversity of problems we solve. Sanket Korgaonkar on LinkedIn See all articles Google TensorFlow, Java Api - used to classify images in real time. Kafka is used to simulate users clicking photographs and sending updates once every 15 seconds. The producer and consumer are interacting through a protocolBuffer - as each image comes in - it gets drawn in a JFrame as a BufferedImage - and the image classification is performed using deep learning - the output is shown on the screen along with a classification confidence. Sanket shared this TensorFlow for Java has arrived! Pioneered a new sub-field in wireless communications, which draws a parallel between actuarial/financial science and wireless communications. This technique, called stochastic ordering, is now used for wireless system comparison and asymptotic performance analysis of wireless systems. (7 IEEE publications)2. Established that the industrial standard in combining schemes for multi-antenna communication is highly sub-optimal under RF interference, and proposed a new low-complexity implementable scheme which performs almost optimally. Media (1) This position has 1 media Hyooristik Home Page Hyooristik Home Page This media is a link Director, Sr. Data Scientist Company Name Perficient Dates Employed Feb 2016 – Apr 2017 Employment Duration 1 yr 3 mos Location Greater Denver Area I've examined a "more optimal" way of data integration (aka ETL) and was able to find a more productive, cost-efficient, adaptable DI product(s) that lead me back to one of the most influential people I've ever worked with, Mike Kamfonas. As he explained, ETL has two functional components, mapping and program logic; the latter he took a step further, terming it Generative Programming or the ability for a program to generate other programs. In our case, we wanted to generate ETL independent of vendor (Informatica, IBM, MS, Oracle, Talend, etc.). Mike helped us uncover that Mapping has Patterns (for example: source -> stage -> type2 dim), and these patterns repeated themselves over & over again with only changes to metadata. The end result, was that you can optimally create generative programs for ETL based upon common patterns. Cost savings better than 50%, adaptable to nearly any ETL and flexible for any platform (including Big Data). Produced a White Paper on this subject and Webinar. Now I'm focused on delivering Big Data solutions for all of our customers. On top of that, she is very organized, diligent and overall a pleasure to work with. I recommend her strongly and hope to work with her again in the future. Natan Fisher Cofounder at SingleSprout July 28, 2016, Udi was a client of Natan’s I had the pleasure of working with Natan during a recent job search. Unlike some recruiters, who try to trick you into interviewing for a job you're not really interested in or would be bad for you, Natan takes the time to get to know you and only gets you the right interviews at the right companies. But it doesn't end there: he offers useful interview and career advice. While working together, I got the feeling that Natan genuinely cares both for my interests as well as the prospective employer - truly a win-win-win situation. On top of all that, he's a very nice guy and we've spent time just chatting about the industry and life in general. Highly recommended! Michele Usuelli Lead Data Scientist at Microsoft - Technical Author August 8, 2016, Aous worked with Michele but at different companies Michele is one of the authors of the excellent book "Building a Recommendation System with R"This book, as far as I know, is the only book on the subject of recommender systems in R. The book is a great resource for those interested in building a recommender system in R from the grounds up. The authors start by giving a good overview of the recommender problems with detailed examples, then in the second chapter they cover the techniques used in recommender systems. The last three chapters present the in-depth process of building and evaluating a recommender system in R. Chapter 5 gives a very detailed example of building a recommender system using unstructured data. I would highly recommend this book! But he is not. Anthony is a genuinely humble, thoughtful, and likable guy that everyone respects. It is a privilege to work with him, and I am glad to call him a friend. View 9 more recommendations View 9 more recommendations recommendations Carly Ramsey Associate Director at Control Risks March 16, 2017, Anthony worked with Carly but at different companies Carly Ramsey is a visionary leader with a passion that is truly inspiring. Her clear, collaborative communication style is truly a superpower. Additionally, she has a thirst for learning and teaching that inspires those around her. She models the skill of appreciative inquiry, embracing what is good about a situation and using it to explore what can be done next, in event the most difficult and stressful situations. It was my great good fortune to work with Carly in the context of a very complex business challenge that included understanding complex stakeholders' positioning and motivation, evolving regulatory requirements, and geopolitical implications of strategies. Her ability to assemble an all-star team and to drive enormously complex objectives was critical to the success of the effort. Her open and receptive approach to feedback was also critical to success. I have no doubt that her personal contribution was one of the critical success factors of a mission-critical engagement. Samiran Ghosh Digital Advisor @Microsoft September 12, 2016, Anthony was senior to Samiran but didn’t manage directly It has been my great good fortune to work with Samiran. He has great domain knowledge, striving always to understand and to improve his scope of expertise. At the same time, he is very generous in sharing what he knows and in helping others. I have been very impressed with his reflective leadership, questioning why things are done in a way that leads to better understanding and growth. His willingness to spend time writing and sharing his knowledge is testament to his nature of helping others to improve. View 6 more recommendations View 6 more recommendations recommendations Brian Wilt Data Science at Facebook March 24, 2015, George managed Brian directly I know Brian from his tenure as a Data Scientist at Intuit, where he was on a team of Ninjas who prototyped innovative data-driven applications. I've managed a lot of Data Scientists in my time, and Brian is among the very best I've had the privilege of supervising. What makes him special is his sharp intellect, excellent people skills, fearlessness in the face of a challenge, and relentless focus. In particular, Brian was instrumental in creating Version 1.0 of the Intuit Commerce Graph that maps the flow of payments between US businesses, capturing on the order of 15% of US GDP. But he did not stop at simply creating this new data platform. He also prototyped multiple end-user applications that demonstrate the power of the Intuit Commerce Graph. For example, one of his prototypes enables small businesses to identify the best geographical locations for expansion, where consumer demand is high but competition is low. His work on the Commerce Graph ultimately contributed to Intuit embracing network effects as a core product strategy. I could go on, but in short Brian is a superb Data Scientist who makes profound contributions, and is also a quintessentially nice guy. I would be delighted to working with Heather again. More Actions Vincent has a premium account Click to upgrade to Premium 3rd degree connection3rd Vincent Granville Pioneering Data Scientist Data Science Central Cambridge University, England Greater Seattle Area 500+ 500+ connections Connect Pending Invitation Sent Well rounded, visionary data science executive with broad spectrum of domain expertise, technical knowledge, and proven success in bringing measurable added value to companies ranging from startups to fortune 100, across multiple industries (finance, Internet, media, IT, security) and domains (data science, operations research, machine learning, computer science, business intelligence, growth hacking, IoT).Vincent developed and deployed new techniques such as hidden decision trees (for scoring and fraud detection), automated tagging, indexing and clustering of large document repositories, black-box, scalable, simple, noise-resistant regression known as the Jackknife Regression (fit for real-time or automated data processing), model-free confidence intervals, combinatorial feature selection algorithms, detecting causation not correlations, and generally speaking, the invention of a set of consistent robust statistical / machine learning techniques that can be understood, implemented, interpreted, leveraged and fine-tuned by the non-expert. Vincent also invented many synthetic metrics that work better than old-fashioned stats, especially on badly-behaved sparse big data. Some of these techniques have been implemented in a Map-Reduce Hadoop-like environment. Some are concerned with identifying true signal in an ocean of noisy data.Vincent is a former post-doctorate of Cambridge University and the National Institute of Statistical Sciences. He created the first IoT platform to automate growth and content generation for digital publishers, using a system of API's for machine-to-machine communications, involving Hootsuite, Twitter, and Google Analytics.Vincent's profile is accessible at http://bit.ly/1jWEfMP and includes top publications, presentations, and work experience with Visa, Microsoft, eBay, NBC, Wells Fargo, and other organisations. Typically, data science algorithms are used to extract actionable information from data. Fields of applications include energy, urban planning, healthcare, engineering, weather forecasting, and transportation sectors - for instance sensors used to monitor road traffic, recommend routes to commuters, and optimize commuting time for everyone. IoT Central (IoTCentral.io) is the leading online resource connecting a community of individuals, organizations and businesses who are focused on products, services, and opportunities in the Internet of Things era. Specifically serving those interested in the business, engineering, or industrial IoT, the site covers IoT Infrastructure, IoT Application Development, IoT Data and IoT Security. More Actions Vincent has a premium account Click to upgrade to Premium 3rd degree connection3rd Vincent Granville Pioneering Data Scientist Data Science Central Cambridge University, England Greater Seattle Area 500+ 500+ connections Connect Pending Invitation Sent Well rounded, visionary data science executive with broad spectrum of domain expertise, technical knowledge, and proven success in bringing measurable added value to companies ranging from startups to fortune 100, across multiple industries (finance, Internet, media, IT, security) and domains (data science, operations research, machine learning, computer science, business intelligence, growth hacking, IoT).Vincent developed and deployed new techniques such as hidden decision trees (for scoring and fraud detection), automated tagging, indexing and clustering of large document repositories, black-box, scalable, simple, noise-resistant regression known as the Jackknife Regression (fit for real-time or automated data processing), model-free confidence intervals, combinatorial feature selection algorithms, detecting causation not correlations, and generally speaking, the invention of a set of consistent robust statistical / machine learning techniques that can be understood, implemented, interpreted, leveraged and fine-tuned by the non-expert. Vincent also invented many synthetic metrics that work better than old-fashioned stats, especially on badly-behaved sparse big data. Some of these techniques have been implemented in a Map-Reduce Hadoop-like environment. Some are concerned with identifying true signal in an ocean of noisy data.Vincent is a former post-doctorate of Cambridge University and the National Institute of Statistical Sciences. He created the first IoT platform to automate growth and content generation for digital publishers, using a system of API's for machine-to-machine communications, involving Hootsuite, Twitter, and Google Analytics.Vincent's profile is accessible at http://bit.ly/1jWEfMP and includes top publications, presentations, and work experience with Visa, Microsoft, eBay, NBC, Wells Fargo, and other organisations. Typically, data science algorithms are used to extract actionable information from data. Fields of applications include energy, urban planning, healthcare, engineering, weather forecasting, and transportation sectors - for instance sensors used to monitor road traffic, recommend routes to commuters, and optimize commuting time for everyone. IoT Central (IoTCentral.io) is the leading online resource connecting a community of individuals, organizations and businesses who are focused on products, services, and opportunities in the Internet of Things era. Specifically serving those interested in the business, engineering, or industrial IoT, the site covers IoT Infrastructure, IoT Application Development, IoT Data and IoT Security. Chief Data Scientist (CDS) Company Name Sentillian Dates Employed Nov 2013 – Mar 2014 Employment Duration 5 mos Location Greater New York City Area I discover insights from data using scientific modeling, linear and logistic regressions, machine learning, and 3i-Mind proprietary data and services. I work closely with the intelligence analysts and advisors, engineering teams and the data analysts, and I am responsible for the creation and the evolution of the data science-based tools and methods critical to producing quality insights & intelligence for our clients.Responsibilities- Leading the development and testing of hypotheses across all functional areas at Intelligence Analysis- Researching and applying multidisciplinary techniques, findings and approaches to 3i-Mind problems- Designing, implementing and analyzing algorithms which substantially impact multiple 3i-Mind problems- Leading development of prototypes and guiding solutions into production- Establishing data science strategic research roadmap- Serving as a team member to consult on complex data science issues, contributing key ideas- Growing and leading the data science groupSentillian (formerly 3i-Mind) Adjunct Professor, Gradutate School of Computer and Information Sciences Company Name NOVA Southeastern University Dates Employed Jan 2002 – Jan 2014 Employment Duration 12 yrs 1 mo Teach graduate level courses in computer and information sciences. Primary research interests are evolutionary and agent based systems, artificial intellience, machine learning, data science, big data.Research Focus - The John Holland genetic algorithm lacks some of the genomic regulatory mechanisms necessary to overcome novel environmental dynamics by fast adaptive change. This simple genetic algorithm uses a haploid chromosome-based cell that reproduces only once during its single generation life span by using a modified asexual reproductive technique. This original cellular structure does not support the expression of recessive genomic characteristics that are essential for adaptive change. Its single life span and reproductive cycle do not allow for the possibility of highly fit parents to continuously contribute to the successful evolution of the population. Asexual reproductive techniques fail to pass the test of natural selection. My principle research develops a new genetic algorithm that is based on an organic and systematic representations of those structural and behavioral characteristics found in highly adaptive organisms. By using a diploid chromosome-based cell that sexually reproduce across many generations; my research has produced a more adaptive optimization algorithm than originally produced by Holland when performance tested using De Jong’s Test Functions. The outcomes of the project provided improved guidelines to California Department of Transportation (Caltrans) for performance-based seismic assessment and analysis of highway bridges by recognizing patterns in and quantifying sensitivity of seismic demand parameters to epistemic and aleatory uncertainties. Post-Doctoral / Graduate Student Research Associate Company Name UCLA Dates Employed Aug 2006 – Dec 2013 Employment Duration 7 yrs 5 mos Summary: Application of system identification, inverse-problem, and signal processing techniques for development and implementation of Structural Health Monitoring Algorithms for deterministic and stochastic dynamic systems.Highlights:Developed an algorithm for rapid assessment of state of health of building structures by localizing and quantifying reduction in the load resistance capacity of lateral load bearing systems of the building. Methodology: Fitting a covariance-based regression model and anomaly detection in stationary ambient vibration data collected before and after an extreme event.Developed an algorithm for estimating nonlinear force-deformation and energy dissipation capacity of building structures. Methodology: Implementing Kalman Filtering for identification of a state-space representation from vibration data collected during earthquake excitations. Supervised several undergraduate students to catalog instrumented buildings from the inventory of Center for Engineering Strong Motion Data (CESMD) in order to assess feasibility of implementation of various structural health monitoring techniques, given building and instrumentation characteristics. Keep it simple and only highlight critical requirements for the role. 3) Submitting my CV only to be asked to fill in a detailed online application form... so the "buzzword bingo" algorithm can screen me out before a human has to make a decision! Also assign class label to this new cluster with minimum or no human intervention. Research Scientist/Project Manager Company Name Siemens Corporate Research Dates Employed Apr 2005 – Apr 2010 Employment Duration 5 yrs 1 mo Location Greater New York City Area Responsible for developing the text analytics and semantics work with Siemens business units, such as Energy, Healthcare and central corporate units, and over the course of five years played a key role in numerous project acquisitions in this space worth more than $ 2.5M.Supervised 3 full time employees, more than 10 interns and consultants, and played a key role in hiring new researchers and engineers in the data mining area.Projects in the Energy sector include developing a system for mining, searching, and monitoring issues in unstructured text service reports using statistical NLP and machine learning technologies, a data cleansing system for reconciling heterogeneous databases using a combination of rules and machine learning technologies, parts forecasting from events and sales/leads data, and advanced knowledge representation for modeling rules and concepts in a Siemens turbine monitoring and diagnostic platform. Projects in the Healthcare sector include semantic annotation and search of clinical images using ontologies, mining temporal event sequences from laboratory diagnostic instruments to discover error patterns, and clustering free text service reports to discover issues in medical imaging instruments and correlate the issues to error patterns.Cross sector projects include developing a system for categorizing indirect spend financial transactions to commodity coding schemes (successfully used by global Siemens supply chain unit as well as Deutsche Telekom), a large scale text analytics platform for monitoring news, blogs, searches on Siemens sites, and call center tickets to discover and track events of interest to Siemens businesses (developed for Siemens corporate communication unit), and working with Siemens IT solutions and services to develop the core analytics components of a business intelligence platform. See more positions Education Stony Brook University Degree Name PhD Field Of Study Computer Science Dates attended or expected graduation 1999 – 2005 My PhD thesis was on scalable and automated semantic annotation of template generated Web content, including HTML pages such as news and vendor sites as well as free text sequential product descriptions, using a combination of machine learning and light weight ontologies. The techniques were used to develop systems for assistive browsing, small form factor devices browsing, and automating transactions on complex Web sites. View 1 more recommendation View 1 more recommendation recommendations Hanyu Zhou Ads Solutions Consultant at Google March 9, 2016, Saikat was Hanyu’s mentor Hanyu worked with me as a data scientist, while at Intuit, for 6 months from 05/2015 to 10/2015. I directly mentored her in a very innovative project where we used Quickbooks small business data to build models of “similar” companies i.e. other small businesses which are similar to a specific small business. The work was challenging in terms of feature engineering and handling noisy/missing values as well as scaling to more than a million Quickbooks companies.Hanyu excelled at both the data modeling and engineering aspects. Even though she was new to the Quickbooks data, she quickly ramped up her understanding and dug into various features of the data. She then tried out different similarity models, implemented them in python, and demonstrated great engineering hygiene by checking in her code regularly as well as maintaining good documentation. Her work drove tremendous interest within the business unit around developing “peer-based” insights and will result in an experiment to go live in the product within the next couple weeks. We could not have asked for a better data scientist!I would strongly vouch for her data science skills, python programming skills, and her eagerness and motivation to learn new skills and solve challenging problems. Please feel free to contact me if you have further questions about her work in Intuit. Emre liked a comment #IDC 24 Mayis, 09:50-10:05 Emre liked Dünya tehdit altında: WanaCrypt0r 2.0 virüsü Dün sabah (09:00) saatlerinden itibaren aralarında Türkiye'nin de bulunduğu 74 ülkeye sibersaldırı düzenlenmeye başlandı. Özellikle İngiltere ve İspanya'yı olumsuz yönde etkileyen bu saldırılar, kapsam alanını genişletmeye devam ediyor. Antivirüs geliştiricisi Avast tarafından yapılan son açıklamalar, WanaCrypt0r 2.0 fidye virüsünün toplamda 99 farklı ülkede 75 bini aşkın farklı sistemi ele geçirdiği yönünde. Fidye yazılımı olarak programlanan WanaCrypt0r 2.0, temelde bir metin dosyasıyla birlikte tüm bilgisayarlara sessiz sedasız bulaşarak verileri ele geçirmeye odaklanıyor. Daha sonrasında sistemlerdeki verileri tamamen şifreleyen zararlı yazılım, kullanıcıdan 300 dolar ile 600 dolar arasında bir fidye talep ediyor. Üç gün içinde ödemenin Bitcoin hesabı üzerinden gerçekleştirilmesi gerektiği özellikle belirtiliyor. WanaCrypt0r 2.0, eğer yedi günde gerekli ödeme yapılmazsa verilerin tamamen silineceği uyarısını da veriyor. Windows güncellemeleri almış olmanız, bu virüsten korunmak için tek ve en doğru çözüm. Bilmediğiniz kişi ve kuruluşlardan gelen emailleri açmayınız ve hemen silin. Emre shared this Istanbul Machine Learning Meetup https://lnkd.in/ggxcKyX 'na Meetup'ta bak. I'm really looking forward to the following weeks!"You get the drift :-) He will be an asset wherever he goes. Alex Sherman Passionate about Customer Analytics | Deloitte Consulting March 31, 2015, Alex was a client of Josiah’s I had the pleasure of taking one of Josiah’s Data Science Trainings for Deloitte Consulting. During the half-day training, Josiah taught data science concepts in Python to a class of 30 practitioners. Using Numpy and Pandas, Josiah discussed a broad set of data exploration and data analysis topics. The course was tremendously useful as I learned new tactics to improve my existing scripts (e.g. how to optimize memory usage when filling in missing values with ‘.fillna’ by using ‘inplace=True’ to prevent copying the data). After the course, Josiah stayed back with several inspired students to discuss how he collected the data for the course by web scraping with the Python library, Beautiful Soup. This was a continued trend from the course, as he was effective throughout in appeasing both new and advanced Python users.I highly recommend Josiah as an engaging corporate data science trainer. As a testament to this statement, I recently began the General Assembly 11-week Data Science course, in which Josiah is also an instructor, because my only wish at the end of the course was for it to last longer. View 4 more recommendations View 4 more recommendations recommendations Thomas LUCAS Senior Associate at Partners Capital April 21, 2016, Josiah was senior to Thomas but didn’t manage directly Of all of the 20+ people I have mentored through the Springboard Data Science workshop, Thomas created the most interesting and creative project I have seen so far. Thomas is tenacious and an incredibly quick learner, and after 6 months of working with him, I can wholeheartedly offer my recommendation. Yuji Shen Software Developer at WholeRen Education, LLC July 31, 2015, Josiah was Yuji’s mentor I met with Yuji for several months as a part of SlideRule's Data Science Workshop, and was able to observe his exponential progress. SlideRule's data science workshop covers the entire Data Science pipeline in R, including exploratory data analysis, data visualization, probability & statistics, natural language processing, and machine learning. Not only did Yuji devour the content covered in the curriculum, but he created several original projects to apply his knowledge and covered significant additional resources that were beyond the scope of the workshop. The last thing I'll say about Yuji is that I was impressed with the rigor with which I applies statistical theory to applied problems. Yuji is an assiduous learner with a lot of potential to add value to an organization as a Data Scientist. I give him my highest recommendation. With this foundation, Mr. Roy has built a 35+ year career in information technology and analytics, acquiring comprehensive knowledge of a wide array of software and hardware, adapting emerging technologies to an organization's needs, and using critical thinking skills to solve complex problems. He is an expert in several complex software suites such as SAS, SPSS, Systat, S-Plus, Stata, EQS, LISREL, LIMDEP and TSP.With 10 years in healthcare IT, Mr. Roy brings significant Epic implementation and application integration experience. More Actions Justin has a account Justin Bleich Coatue Management Coatue Management University of Pennsylvania - The Wharton School New York, New York 500+ 500+ connections Connect Pending Invitation Sent My primary area of interest is in forecasting and prediction, where I use a wide array of machine learning algorithms and/or Bayesian models. Throughout my career to date, I have adopted the mantra that the ability to rapidly experiment and iterate on ideas is the key to success. I am a big believer in building flexible analysis tools that allow for quick testing of many concepts and prototypes, and that a data scientist must be a strong enough programmer to implement such a platform on his or her own. Robert McGinley VP of Engineering at Zodiac January 14, 2017, Justin managed Robert directly Rob is an outstanding software engineer who is well on the path towards becoming a world-class leader of a technology organization.As the first employee at Zodiac, Rob took an MVP analytics backend that I had developed and single-handedly architected, coded, and scaled an entire web stack from scratch that ultimately helped us raise an institutional seed round. Also, not only did Rob build the stack, but he also explained his design choices and reasoning to the team so we could improve our knowledge of software engineering. Moreover, as a data scientist by background running a technology organization, I quickly saw Rob as a mentor with regards to best practices for both the development and management sides of software engineering. As our organization grew, so did Rob’s level of responsibility. While still being the head architect and staying deeply focused on development, Rob helped us recruit some of the strongest engineering talent in Philadelphia across both senior and junior levels. Within weeks, it become evident that Rob also has a passion for training junior talent and bringing their skills to the next level. One of Rob’s greatest strengths is his ability to lead by example. Not once was he unwilling to dive into our codebase and do whatever was necessary at any time. From an engineering perspective, I have no doubt Rob can build pretty much anything. What really stands out, though, is his ability to understand the business and product needs and develop accordingly. He pushed for simple implementations for MVP-style features, but could take the architecture deep when the product needed stability. And never once was Rob not open to meritocratic debate about the best path forward. I can say with complete confidence Zodiac would not have achieved its successes without Rob. Carla shared this Fast Data and a Little Bit of Robot Rock, Paper, Scissors Fun at Strata Hadoop Carla liked But there’s a problem. Quantifying people is not nearly as easy as quantifying grain. Quantification requires standardization, but people aren’t standardized and the data collection methods we have for analyzing people aren’t perfect. So, shortcuts have to be made and proxies must be used to reduce the rich complexity of human experience into discreet buckets. You see "numbers", I see the future for a great customer experiences. The possibilities that data mining, semantic and sentiment analysis can bring from structured and unstructured data is limitless, your data is the voice of the customer, are you paying attention, I know I am.What can your data tell you, that you don’t already know? Data Mining is about explaining the past and predicting the future by means of data analysis. We are collecting more data than ever before, yet many organizations are still looking for better ways to obtain value from their data and compete in the marketplace. How old are my customers, did they go to college, do they have children, where do they live, where do they shop, what is their annual income, etc? View 5 more recommendations View 5 more recommendations recommendations Lori Jenkins Customer Success May 4, 2016, Christopher was a client of Lori’s In 2015 we executed a pretty interesting experiment at the Canadian Broadcasting Corporation. Could a testing culture even take root in product teams? We have a lot of products at the CBC - over 18 native apps (iOS, Android, Xbox), three CMS's, four variants of mobile web. And 7 distinct agile teams who manage to manage them all.I was lucky that Lori was assigned to my account.Lori came already aware that testing is a system of activities that becomes embedded in a culture over time. Testing isn't something that you do just once, fail to get a conference-worthy hero slide eye popping result, and rage quit. It's something that has to be set up to scale and requires a strong fail-learning tolerance. The very fact that she knew this, knew how to communicate it, and worked with me to scale it was a joy and an advantage.At no point did I feel that Lori was reading from a standardized operating procedure or a script. She knew the material cold and believed in what she was saying and doing.We had a number of really great kick-offs with various teams. We sorted which ones were most engaged and focused on those cases. She helped me build up some of the resistance to null-hypothesis returns. She brought in the right folks at the right time to educate the different types of developers and product managers we had on different teams.As of 2016, several product teams have a culture of ongoing testing. Lori was a key contributor to that success.That success and the pleasure it was working with Lori forms the basis of this recommendation. If you are an impact-oriented, driven, leader, you would be very lucky to have Lori working with you. Such people are exceedingly rare.I would hire Lori for a senior role because that would guarantee she'd be deployed against the correct problems/opportunities, and, would be able to shape a culture of iteration, learning, and performance. Dates Employed Jun 2014 – Jan 2016 Employment Duration 1 yr 8 mos Location US After founding Green Econometrics Inc. as a management consulting company with expanding roles in data science, business development and marketing, the acquisition of my company by Beneficial Holding Inc. (BFHJ) enables the company to address new market opportunities by integrating energy and environmental sensors and security technologies for enhanced efficiency and insight. BFHJ together with its acquisition of Energy Systems and Installation (ESI), a solar engineering and consulting company, is expanding the scale and scope of energy efficiency services through solar, energy storage, and LED products, as well as energy and environmental monitoring and analysis services. By equipping the built environment with context aware sensors that measure and monitor energy and environmental conditions, BFHJ will play a crucial role in optimizing energy efficiency through IoT, big data, and analytics. BFHJ plans to enhance the differentiation of solar and LEDs with device control sensors that create higher value for client by optimizing energy efficiency and improving visibility into building systems such as HVAC performance, occupancy, traffic flow and environmental conditions. Michael Davies is the Chief Technology Officer of Beneficial Holdings and is leading BFHJ’s integration of solar, LED and sensor technologies. Highlights Experience Chief Data Scientist, SVP Company Name AdColony, Opera Mediaworks Dates Employed Jun 2014 – Present Employment Duration 3 yrs Location Greater Seattle Area Accountable for building the vision and strategy to realize the full potential of the data contained within the company for its various functions, developing and innovating cutting edge research and development of predictive models and optimization algorithms for ad targeting, serving as the technical and scientific leader for Machine Learning and advanced industry leadership in Machine Learning.1. Designed and developed mobile ad behavior targeting system based on Spark/Hbase/s3. The Hbase has 1.6 billion unique mobile devices. The software system processes billions transactions each day and calculate the most interesting ads for every device/user daily. This system has improved the click through rate over 2 times which amounts to tens of millions dollar extra income per year for the company.2. Designed and developed the first large scale user-based recommendation system that can support billions of users with daily updates. The core calculation module was implemented in C and highly optimized to get the 'close to metal' performance, which is crucial to processing the amount of data using the cutting edge algorithms.3. Designed and developed a fully automatic pipeline for cluster creation, stopping, restarting, CDH installation, storage attaching for best performance and flexibility. Architect Data Scientist Company Name SEOMOZ Dates Employed Sep 2012 – Jun 2014 Employment Duration 1 yr 10 mos Location Greater Seattle Area Responsible for designing and implementing algorithms for extracting information from large in-house datasets, and collecting, processing, generating metrics from web crawl of billions URLs every week.1. Designed an ensemble algorithm based on list-wise learning-to-rank method, forward neural network, linear classification methods for PA (page authority) metric, which is one of the major metric services that the company provides to its customers. Research tools were implemented in Python. Production codes were in C++. 2. Designed and developed a generalized linear model (GLM) package using Python and Numpy. The package is open sourced in github. Various regularization methods are provided in this package. The regularization, which is missing in other available python packages, can help avoid overfitting problem in machine learning model training. 3. LDA(latent dirichlet allocation) training and analysis on large wiki data. Designed an algorithm to extract similar search queries based on the LDA results. Developed a library that can be used to run LDA in Python. 4. Designed and implemented keyword search volume prediction tool. This tool is used to predict the google search volume for any given search query.5. Designed and implemented parked domain modeling to detect whether a domain is parked, which will have impact on the google (or other search engine) ranking of related domains.6. Designed and implemented automatic subdomain similarity detection for any given domain. 7. Large scale keyword categorization analysis. Keyword counts and volume for each category. 8. Designed and implemented domain spam prediction model. This tool is used to prevent the penalization from google on search result rankings on the company’s customers. 9. Designed and implemented domain automatic categorization model. Based on the data set of google search results of 17 million keywords, 900 million URLs of 13 million domains, the model inferences categories for every domain. More Actions David has a premium account Click to upgrade to Premium David Rieken Chief Data Scientist at Aclara Technologies Aclara Technologies Washington University in St. Louis Greater St. Louis Area 220 220 connections Connect Pending Invitation Sent I am a signal processing expert with a wide-ranging background in detection and estimation, digital signal processing, and linear algebra. I have over 15 years experience in design, prototyping, implementation, and testing of signal processing algorithms with an emphasis in communications, passive sensor arrays, and radar. I am an experienced team leader with a recognized history of leading small, focused technical teams in solving difficult problems quickly and effectively.What differentiates me from many of my peers is that I prefer to take a rigorous mathematical approach to all problems I solve. In most of what I’ve done the bulk of the work has been in developing a mathematical model (usually stochastic) explaining the data as a function of unknown parameters. This model can be derived either empirically or from first principles, but should be verified experimentally before proceeding. With a good model, the algorithm usually can be derived with well-known straightforward methods.My publication record speaks to my experience, with peer reviewed papers or patents completed in most projects that I have been involved in.Specialties: statistical signal processing, power-line communications, smart grid, PHY layer comms, MIMO radar, GMTI and AMTI radar, SARsignal processing, communications, random processes, linear algebra, power systems analysis See moreSee more of undefined summary Highlights Experience Chief Data Scientist Company Name Aclara Technologies Dates Employed Jul 2015 – Present Employment Duration 1 yr 11 mos Location Greater St. Louis Area Technical and managerial lead for the research and development team. Responsible for proof-of-concept studies on high-value, high-risk technologies. Primarily focused on smart grid systems. Media (1) This position has 1 media Fault detection and localization Fault detection and localization This media is a video Sr. Communications Scientist Company Name Aclara Dates Employed Feb 2012 – Jul 2015 Employment Duration 3 yrs 6 mos Location Greater St. Louis Area Largely because of the successes in my previous position, Aclara began an ambitious project to develop a market-ready next generation PLC system. I serve as team lead for the PHY/MAC development team, which consists of 8 engineers, most with advanced degrees. I led the team in aggressively researching high-risk problems, and succeeded in solving all the major problems within the allocated time frame. Organized a team of talented engineers to work cooperatively by encouraging vigorous debate, assigning problems according to talent, and holding daily stand-up status meetings, and weekly seminars in which novel research was presented for discussion. Implemented a framework for cooperatively writing Matlab utilities using an object-oriented framework and enforcing documentation standards. Led (and participated in) research and development in PHY layer algorithms for adaptive equalization, channel coding, CDMA, OFDM, and CFAR sync detection and MAC layer research in CSMA and pre-planned user scheduling for massive multi-user access. Adjunct Company Name St. Charles Community College Dates Employed Jan 2013 – May 2013 Employment Duration 5 mos Location Greater St. Louis Area I was the instructor for "Introduction to Circuits", a sophomore-level course in circuit analysis, for one semester. Prepared lectures, assigned and graded homework, and wrote and graded exams. I was offered the position again in 2014, but declined because my commitments at Aclara during that time period would not permit it. Communication Scientist Company Name Aclara Power-Line Systems, Inc. Dates Employed Feb 2006 – Feb 2012 Employment Duration 6 yrs 1 mo Location Greater St. Louis Area Distribution Control Systems, Inc. (DCSI) is the manufacturer of theTWACS power-line communication (PLC) system, which utilities use for advanced metering infrastructure (AMI). I joined the research and development department at DCSI because although the TWACS technology was slower than most communication networks, I was interested in the potential for Shannon-limited communications over the power distribution network. In this period I conducted research, both independently and as technical lead, in power line channel sounding, analog hardware for capacitive coupling, and novel modulation techniques. I designed and oversaw the development of hardware and the associated algorithm for precision channel transfer function estimation, which I tested extensively on real transmission networks, some tens of miles long. I designed a system and method for passive signal transmission using a resonator circuit and a modified phase shift keying modulator. I also contributed to the IEEE P1901.2 standard for narrowband PLC. Because I recognized a lack of DSP expertise among our firmware engineers I designed and taught a series of in-house courses on practical DSP and digital communication theory, which were well received by participants. Research Engineer Company Name General Dynamics AIS Dates Employed 2002 – 2006 Employment Duration 4 yrs Location Ann Arbor, MI Veridian had acquired the remote sensing laboratory formerly known as the Environmental Research Institute of Michigan. Veridian was purchased by General Dynamics in 2003, which renamed this facility the Michigan Research and Development Center and moved it to nearby Ypsilanti, MI. As a member of the technical staff here I was responsible for writing grant proposals and conducting research on grants collaboratively with colleagues. During my four years here I contributed to many successful proposals including one on which I was the principal investigator. I was a sought after expert in signal processing, particularly statistical signal processing and detection and estimation theory, and worked on numerous contracted research and development projects in that capacity. I contributed novel algorithms in a wide-ranging field of applications including adaptive interference suppression for GPS and SAR, buried target detection, target mass estimation, foliage penetrating radar (FOPEN), and soft target GMTI. I organized and performed field data collections in support of several of those efforts and tested the algorithms on real data where available. I was also a key contributor to several PHY layer algorithms in a novel low-power MIMO wireless communications system. Senior Quantitative Analyst Company Name Electronic Arts (EA) Dates Employed Dec 2013 – Dec 2014 Employment Duration 1 yr 1 mo Location Redwood City, Ca. Working on projects related to game fraud within EA's Business Operations group: creating visualization tools, analyzing player data and working as a liaison to our game teams.The position has required me to:1) Build architectures that connect various databases and data sources together, including multiple SQL DBs, flat files and web portals.2) Analyze players using gameplay, transaction and account data to discover patterns of behavior within single games and across multiple games (e.g. how do players jump around multiple F2P titles, or how often do player IPs change over time).3) Create player models for identifying both good and bad player behavior using various data mining techniques such as regression analysis, clustering and decision trees to classify players.4) Develop production level code and systems that monitor and act upon player data within our in-house risk decisioning system.5) Act as a liaison between game teams and our operations group, working with development and analytic groups to combine their various data sources. Technical Analyst Company Name Electronic Arts Dates Employed Jun 2012 – Dec 2013 Employment Duration 1 yr 7 mos Location Redwood City, Ca. I worked on R&D projects related to streaming games and second screen experiences at EA's Chief Creative Office. Also provided analytic and visualization support to Waystone Games for their game, Dawngate.During my time at the Chief Creative Office I worked on the following projects:1) Games Streaming Service - The team built a brand new game streaming service for investigating how EA games could be delivered on TV platforms using commonly owned hardware such as set-top boxes and tablets. The major feature of the service was every game had a unique tablet controller and every game was altered to make use of the touch controller interface. I was in charge of analyzing the players we acquired, helped alter games to make them ready for our service and ran design research experiments to help with the UX of the service. This included:a) Administering surveys and conducting user studies with current and potential customers of the streaming service. Five major user study sessions were conducted over the course of the project, with over 50 participants.b) Adding telemetry hooks directly into a games source and making game modifications (e.g. removing UI or altering game mechanics) to better suit our tablet control scheme.c) Analyzed player and system data we received from the service. I created reports around acquiring and retaining players, how players performed in our games and the spending habits of our players.2) Game Analytic Advisor - Worked as an advisor for game teams regarding their game analytic efforts. I built visualization prototypes and stepped teams through the data they needed to collect in order to run typically game analytic reports, such as churn analysis, game balancing and price point analysis.3) Companion App Development - Helped structure and design the player profile portion of the Need for Speed: Rivals companion app which visualizes player data from the game. Quadratyx helps dozens of customers in India and abroad, and also performs high-end research in Big Data Analytics.PhD in Data Mining and Machine Learning in 1995 from Johns Hopkins University, which could make him one of the earliest PhD-holders in Data Mining in India. Prior to that completed my Master's thesis in Next Generation Expert Systems from IIT-Madras Computer Science.Automatically building mega-catalogs from Hubble Space Telescope images was PhD thesis. The software that designed by me is used till date in scores of countries. And paper on the topic continues to be a top-cited paper in the area of Decision Trees and Machine Learning.In the past 24 years, I worked for world-class research labs such as Siemens Corporate Research - Princeton, IBM Research - Delhi and National Center for Software Technology (now CDAC, Mumbai). Also been instrumental in setting up three startup companies that drove innovation in data mining in vocational skilling, healthcare and supply chain management.8 issued US patents, over a dozen patent-pending innovations, and scores of international publications, all in the area Data Science. Raja liked You hear the term "Data is the New Oil". This is a comparison between the list of top 10 companies by market capitalization in the years 2011 and 2017. This is part of the overall trend that shifted power from the enterprise to the consumer, which (in my opinion) the iPhone played a major role in. SOURCE OF THE TABLES: Wikipedia. And I don't think that we see those things. More Actions Ken has a account Ken Lord Data Scientist at SAP SAP Hunter College Denver, Colorado 143 143 connections Connect Pending Invitation Sent Experienced Data Scientist with teaching, training, and leadership experience.Do you have math to do?Is it the kind of math that has already made other people cry?That's what I like doing.Some people say that the biggest leap for the automobile was mass production, with the Ford Model T. I respectfully disagree. The biggest leap for automobile, the invention that made it possible for more people than ever to own them was the adjustable seat. We're entering an age of data storage and machine learning where we can make courses (for people) custom-tailored to the learner. That's what I'm going to do. I'm making the adjustable seat... but for learning. None of your employees, and none of your children, should ever be stuck in a seat reading a text when they're video learners... none should be watching a video when they're text learners... we can make outcome-based (not test-based) effective learning that works (whether aiming for a high school diploma, a promotion, or a new job) for everyone. Ying Li on LinkedIn Publish dateAugust 25, 2015 Experience Chief Technology Officer Company Name DataSpark Dates Employed Apr 2016 – Present Employment Duration 1 yr 2 mos Location Singapore At DataSpark, we study interconnected world of digital devices and their users. The devices include mobile phones, tablets, TV set-top boxes and broadband devices, and the users are subscribers, visitors, or machines. We work predominantly with the digital trail of users’ interactions, enriched by the data describing the physical and virtual world. We design, develop and deploy software platforms as well as data mining and machine learning algorithms, which in turn produce and visualize insights at scale about the interconnected world. We aspire to produce actionable and trusted insights about humanity which is always on the move in the physical and (increasingly also in the) virtual worlds. More Actions Ravi has a account Ravi Iyer Data Scientist / Moral Psychologist Ranker.com University of Southern California Greater Los Angeles Area 500+ 500+ connections Connect Pending Invitation Sent Ravi Iyer occupies a unique space at the intersection of data science and moral psychology. He is a cofounder and the Chief Data Scientist for Ranker, a crowdsourced list website that collects millions of monthly consumer opinions. He remains an active academic and is also the executive director of Civil Politics, a non-profit that uses technology to bridge the divide between practitioners and researchers in moral psychology. He is an applied data science consultant for Zenzi, Carhub, and the Institute for the Bio-Cultural Study of Religion. He holds a PhD in Psychology from the University of Southern California and remains an active researcher, having published 20+ articles in leading peer-reviewed psychology journals over the past few years, most of which concern the empirical study of moral and political attitudes. His work has been featured in the New York Times, the Wall Street Journal, the Atlantic, South by Southwest, NPR, the BBC, among other press and academic outlets. He is the co-founder of numerous academic social science projects that leverage technology to collect larger, more diverse datasets, including BeyondThePurchase.org (a consumer psychology data site),YourMorals.org (which focuses on moral psychology), ExploringMyReligion.org (which focuses on the scientific study of religion), PsychWiki.com, and VoteHelp.org.Links to press and research More Actions Dr. Kedar has a account 3rd degree connection3rd Dr. Kedar Kulkarni Senior Researcher at IBM Research IBM Research University of Illinois Bengaluru Area, India 500+ 500+ connections Connect Pending Invitation Sent Dr. Kedar Kulkarni obtained his B.Tech / M.Tech from IIT-Bombay, and Ph.D from the University of Illinois, USA. During his PhD, he made several algorithmic contributions to the field of mathematical optimization as applied to distributed parameter chemical and biological systems. Thereafter, he worked as a plant optimization engineer at Air Liquide in Houston, USA before joining GE global research where, among other research activities, he was instrumental in developing novel and efficient techniques to solve wind farm micro-siting optimization problems. Following his stint at GE, he was a senior researcher in the controls / optimization group at ABB corporate research in Bangalore, India where he led a team to develop innovative math modeling and optimization strategies for efficient design and operation of different systems (specifically renewables). Until recently, he was a data scientist at Fixstream Inc. where he developed novel machine learning / data mining algorithms to address complex operational problems in modern cloud-enabled data centers. In his free time, he also mentored budding data scientists on the e-learning portal www.springboard.com. He is currently a senior researcher at IBM Research where he develops novel cognitive/analytics/data science/optimization/math modeling solutions for different IBM businesses.He has over 13 years of experience in mathematical modeling/simulation, optimization and machine learning. He has more than 30 international publications including 5 first-filings and 1 book to his credit. He has advised a Masters thesis student (UPES, Dehradun) and is currently co-advising a PhD student (IIT-Hyderabad, India). He has refereed many international journals/conferences of repute and has been invited for lectures/talks at various educational / research institutions / fora. See moreSee more of undefined summary Highlights Follow Follow {:entityName} Diana’s Articles 437 followers Embracing Immutable Server Pattern Deployment on AWS Diana Tkachenko on LinkedIn Publish dateSeptember 8, 2016 See all articles Experience Software Engineer Company Name Google Dates Employed Mar 2017 – Present Employment Duration 3 mos Location Mountain View Data Platform Engineer, Core Infrastructure Company Name Stitch Fix Dates Employed Apr 2015 – Oct 2016 Employment Duration 1 yr 7 mos Location San Francisco, CA I build any and all tools that let data scientists do data science. I stood up a build and deploy pipeline from scratch that enabled data scientists to package their code and deploy into production on AWS. We use Netflix's immutable server pattern in our deployments - building RPMs from spec files, deploying the artifact to an RPM repository, baking an AMI and launching this AMI into AWS inside an ASG backed by a load balancer. All these steps have been simplified down to a few button clicks to make the process as smooth as possible. I am currently working to make this process even easier and more approachable. In addition, I maintain the execution portion of our ETLs and other jobs on Jenkins - making sure the Jenkins slave machines have what is needed to support our jobs. Currently I am building out a more robust execution service that will run all jobs inside Docker containers.
